Sequence Information.Peptide Name: LK4 (Synthetic AMPs, Lys-rich, Leu-rich, XXA, UCLL1c)

Literature.Author: Ouyang X, Li B, Yang T, Yang Y, Ba Z, Zhang J, Yang P, Liu Y, Wang Y, Zhao Y, Mao W, Wu X, Zeng X, Zhong C, Liu H, Zhang Y, Gou S, Ni J. 2024
Literature.Title: High Therapeutic Index alpha-Helical AMPs and Their Therapeutic Potential on Bacterial Lung and Skin Wound Infections

Sequence Information.Comments: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (77.78%) toLK3L: 44%; K: 44%.Activity: active against S. aureus ATCC 25923 (MIC 4 uM), B. subtilis ATCC 23857 (MIC 8 uM), K. pneumoniae ATCC 700603 (MIC 4 uM), E. coli ATCC 25922 (MIC 2 uM), P. aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC 8 uM), A. baumannii ATCC 19606 (MIC 4 uM).In vitro toxicity: hRBC: HC10 5.42 uM. HC50 64 uM. hemolytic. LC50 8 uM toxic to human embryonic kidney cell line (HEK293T).Structure:  random coil in water and helical in 50% TFE. Helicity is length-dependent and longer peptides are more helical in the series.
